hypothesis_content.title: Overbought Bounce Rejection → Short-Term Retest
hypothesis_content.statement: After a sharp bounce from support (like $85K BTC mentioned in news), if price fails to break above the 61.8% Fibonacci retracement of the preceding decline on the 4-hour chart with declining volume, it will retest the recent lows within 3-5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Contrarian 'buy signals' mentioned in news may represent crowded trades. Failed retests of key Fibonacci levels often indicate weak momentum and lead to retests of recent lows as late bulls get trapped.
entry_conditions: BTC bounces >8% from recent swing low (e.g., $85K)
Price rejects at 61.8% Fib level (4H chart)
Volume on rejection candle < volume on bounce candle
RSI(14) on rejection > 60 but turning down

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to within 1% of recent swing low
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks above 78.6% Fib level with volume

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues through Fib resistance with increasing volume, invalidating the rejection pattern.
